question: So, let me start with your personal life, Shizuku-san. What is the first thing you do when you wake up in the morning?
reply: In the morning I brush my teeth, wash my face....and I go back to my room.

question: You go back to your room?
reply: I go on my phone and checking social media and idol news...

question: Don't you have breakfast?
reply: After checking my phone, I'll go to the living room to eat...

question: What is your favorite thing for breakfast?
reply: Yogurt.

question: What's your favorite dessert?
reply: Bananas... I guess?

question: How about a drink of your choice?
reply: ....Mixed juice.

question: Then tell us how you spend your time at school.
reply: ...After class, I go to the roof or the library during our breaks...

question: So it's a calming place for you, Shizuku-san?
reply: It's quiet, so. Just right for looking at my phone........

question: Do you have a favorite subject?
reply: Everything, I don't dislike.... anything.

question: Are you good at studying?
reply: Hmm... My teacher's stories are interesting. So... I try to properly concentrate.

question: What do you do on your off days?
reply: I go fishing in the sea and watch videos of my favorite idols.

question: Fishing is a tough hobby to get into, isn't it? So your favorite place in Hoshimi City is of course the sea?
reply: Hmm...I can just sit in silence. Sometimes I go with Chisa (Shiraishi)-chan, too.

question: So, about idols. Why did you become an idol yourself?
reply: I've always liked idols. And for various reasons, I joined the agency.

question: What do you like about idols?
reply: They're always sparkling... they give you energy.

question: It's true that when you see them on stage, you'll be energized. If you hadn't become an idol, what do you think you would be doing?
reply: I can't imagine.... I think I would have been going to my idol's live shows.

question: What does the stage performance mean to you, Shizuku-san?
reply: It's still a bit of a strange place to be, because I've been on the cheering side for so long.

question: How did you feel when you first went on stage?
reply: I was really scared, but we were all in it together and we got through it.

question: What's the most important thing for you as an idol?
reply: To think about the feelings of the people who are always cheering you on...

question: You could say that you've always loved idols. Then, what kind of people are your fans like now?
reply: I'm so happy to hear people calling my name at a live show... They're such important people to me.

question: With the phrase "I will not lose to anyone here!" in mind, what are your strengths as an idol?
reply: My idol.... knowledge?

question: You are indeed an idol lover, Shizuku-san. Have you had a moment in your career where you felt a bond with someone?
reply: I practiced smiling and dancing with everyone and I got to talk to Chisa-chan... there has been many moments like that.

question: You're all very close to each other at Hoshimi Production, aren't you? Do you have any rivals in your heart among these members?
reply: A rival...? I don't know....

question: So how about the person you consider your best friend?
reply: It's.... Chisa-chan. She's always encouraging me and pushing me forward.

question: If you could describe your relationship with the members of Hoshimi Productions in one word, how would you describe it?
reply: Comrades...

question: Do you have any dreams that you want to achieve at Hoshimi Productions?
reply: I want to be number one. It's going to be tough, but...

question: If your dream came true, who would you want to tell first?
reply: Who would I pick... I'd rather talk about it first with everyone... than report it, I guess.

question: Next, let's hear about the song. What was your first impression of "Shine Purity" when you first heard it?
reply: "Oooooohhh"...... is what I thought.

question: Ohh, how does that make you feel?
reply: Compared to the other idols, I'm surprised at how intensively I feel.

question: If you had to describe "Shine Purity" in one word, how would you describe it?
reply: ...Fresh.

question: What's your favorite lyric in "Shine Purity"?
reply: "The sky lit up, I saw myself in my dream".

question: What is it that you like about that line?
reply: It reinds me of... when I first fell in love with idols.

question: I see. Which do you like better, singing or dancing, Shizuku-san?
reply: Singing... I guess? Dancing is much harder to keep up with...

question: Is your favorite music genre, of course, idol music?
reply: Yes... The idols of the past and the idols of today are all amazing. I learn a lot from their live performances and their behavior.

question: What is your most memorable memory from your childhood?
reply: The first time I saw an idol live.

question: How did you feel the first time you saw an idol live?
reply: It was so shiny and beautiful. I can remember it, but I can't describe it well....

question: That's not true, your emotions come through loud and clear. Did you have dreams when you were a child?
reply: I was interested in idols....

question: Well, then, what was the happiest moment for you so far?
reply: The day I got my first fan letter.... I've always loved idols, and I've always sent them out, so I'm really happy to be on the receiving end.

question: That's the first time you've felt that way since you've been on the receiving end. What's the most important thing you've ever done?
reply: I'm always trying my best to be like the idol I've always admired.

question: We're already near the end of the interview. What are you looking forward to the most right now?
reply: I was scared of it before, but now I'm looking forward to the live show. I'm with everyone....so...

question: Do you have any worries these days?
reply: I'm not very good at talking.

question: What kind of idol do you want to be?
reply: Even by just a litle bit... I want to be an idol who encourages everyone.

question: That's wonderful. I'm sure there are many people who have already been given courage by you. What would you like to say to yourself 10 years from now?
reply: Hmm.... there's still room for improvement.

question: What does being an idol mean to you, Shizuku-san?
reply: Make everyone smile... and give them a dream to belive in.

question: Lastly, could you give a message to your fans?
reply: Thank you for your support... I'm not quite there yet, but I'll do my best, so please keep supporting me.
